intro: Eschscholzia foeniculacea, commonly known as the western fennel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies, and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are finely divided and have a strong, spicy fragrance similar to fennel. The plant is often used in herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
